title: How is multimedia used in movies? - Quora

response.answer_text: The “term” mutlimedia is massive regarding its usage in film production involvments. However it can safely be argued that the majority of mutlimedia usage in film industry is presented in post-production. That is, after the shooting has ended. Post-production includes video editing using special software and equipment, Visual effects creation and editing, sound editing etc.

Multimedia is an umbrella term like elements setup in a burger, that collaborated burger is a movie and it needs all graphics, animation, 3d scenes, VFX manipulation, sounds, video editing, image manipulation, rotoscope, CGI, Visual reality establishment and so on, So one umbrella term is needed to make a movie. All sectors are binds with one another, like cheese, tomato, and salad…i think the answer is appealing.
